titleproper.value:
Guide to the Kenneth Siegel Photograph Collection
                    <lb/>1970's
                    <lb/>
                    <num>PR 298</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Susan Kriete

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2013-06-18T11:38-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: This collection consists of 97 photographic prints by Kenneth Siegel. The majority depict scenes and people in and around New York's Times Square in the 1970's.

p.value: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as: Kenneth Siegel Photograph Collection, PR 298, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Siegel's work is rounded out and contrasted by the "other" New York of politicians, celebrities, and high society events.
"Phone booths and subway entrances" show people posed in front of these elements.

subject.value: Street life--New York (State)--New York--History--20th century--Pictorial works.
Street vendors -- New York (State) -- New York
